name: Alun-Alun Bangli
address: Jl. Brigjen Ngurah Rai, Kawan, Kec. Bangli, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali 80614, Indonesia
review 1:
Alun-Alun Kota Bangli: A Vibrant Heartbeat in Bali's Heartland

Nestled in the heartland of Bali, Alun-Alun Kota Bangli emerges as a vibrant centerpiece, pulsating with local culture and community spirit. This dynamic town square invites visitors to partake in the rhythm of daily life, offering a unique blend of tradition, modernity, and a sense of community that is truly enchanting.

As you step into Alun-Alun Kota Bangli, you are greeted by an atmosphere teeming with energy. The open square is surrounded by a lively array of shops, cafes, and stalls, each contributing to the kaleidoscope of colors and flavors that define this bustling space. It's a place where locals and visitors seamlessly intertwine, creating a harmonious tapestry of shared experiences.

The heart of Alun-Alun Kota Bangli is its vibrant market, where local vendors proudly showcase an array of Balinese crafts, textiles, and traditional delicacies. Exploring the market feels like a cultural journey, with each stall telling a story of Bali's artistic heritage and the skillful hands behind the intricate creations.

One cannot help but be captivated by the iconic landmark at the center of the square‚Äîan expansive banyan tree that serves as a meeting point and a symbol of unity. Beneath its sprawling branches, locals gather for socializing, impromptu performances, and community events. The tree seems to echo the heartbeat of the town, fostering a sense of togetherness that is both heartwarming and infectious.

As the day unfolds, Alun-Alun Kota Bangli transforms into a lively arena for cultural events and performances. Traditional dances, music, and local ceremonies bring the square to life, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the rich tapestry of Balinese culture. The experience is not just about witnessing these performances but actively participating in the joyous celebration that defines the spirit of Alun-Alun Kota Bangli.

The square also serves as a gateway to nearby attractions, making it a strategic starting point for exploring the beauty of Bangli. Whether you're heading to ancient temples, lush landscapes, or cultural landmarks, Alun-Alun Kota Bangli acts as a dynamic hub that connects you to the broader tapestry of Bali's treasures.

In conclusion, Alun-Alun Kota Bangli is a must-visit destination for those seeking an authentic Balinese experience. Its vibrant market, cultural performances, and the welcoming embrace of the community create a tapestry of memories that linger long after your visit. As you navigate the bustling energy of this town square, you'll discover that Alun-Alun Kota Bangli is not just a place‚Äîit's a living, breathing testament to the vibrant heart of Bali.
review 2: Great Open Space Area in Bangli. Many Facilities in the area such as Battery Car, Food Court and Playground. Best place to go with Family.
review 3: Yesterday I visited one of the places in bangli district, in downtown bangli. I visited the newly completed bangli square and was given official in 2022. Address is report street. Bangli district. It has a place of startegis and its own appeal. Open 24 hours and have facilities of staging stage, toilets, special line of disability, canteen, basketball court, volleyball court, skate park and have a play ground. And extensive parking allowed buses to travel to motorcycles to be safe and comfortable when visiting the bangli square
review 4: Spacious Alun Alun aka city park. They have food court, tennis court, skateboard arena, kids playground. Stopped by here while waiting for my hubby doing a shalat Jumat at Mesjid Agung close to Alun Alun otw to Kintamani.
review 5:
Passed by here and there was a large carnival happening. Awesome Park

Seems like it would be very hot during the day. Hopefully they‚Äôll plant many more shade/fruit trees or construct shade structures

name: Mujair Nyat-Nyat Pak Bagong
address: Jl. Tirta Geduh, Bebalang, Kec. Bangli, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali 80614, Indonesia
review 1:
Serving one of the best nyat-nyat dish in Bali. Located in Bangli, it is far from the bustling Denpasar. Somehow the location has the perfect climate to enjoy the spicy dish.

I personally like the fried mujair very much, reminded me of childhood. I only add a little bit of nyat-nyat spices.

Everyone here is helpful, the place is basically an open traditional Balinese house. It has a very pretty fish pond too!
review 2: Stopped here on the way back from lake Batur. Good place to try out the mujair nyat nyat..a local delicacy which is fish dish with local spices.
review 3: my first time to try this so called mujair nyat-nyat. it was great. nice experience. the taste was great bruh. and the sambal matah made great combo with the fish. wanna comeback sometime.
review 4:
Traditional fish dish!! They accept request well and soup is one of unique dish here.
Don't miss Loloh cemcem, traditional herbal drink, taste like sweet and sour. It's diluted by soda is creative way to try!!
review 5:
Went there to fed my curiousity about Mujair Nyat-Nyat, and it wasn't dissapointing.

It's located in the center of Bangli, 3 minutes from Kintamani-Gianyar main road, so it's easy to reach. They have parking space that fits for 5-7 cars, i think it's easy to get a parking spot.

I ordered a package of Mujair Nyat-Nyat, which contains a portion of rice, Plecing Kangkung, Jukut Undis, 2 types of Sambal, and Mujair Nyat Nyat. Everything was good, but i love Jukut Undis the most, it's like Rawon in East Java, but it contains beans and other mysterious ingredient that i hadn't ever tasted before.

Not too pricey, a nice-to-know dishes when you're in Bangli residence.
